events.name: Committing - One step at a time

venue.name: E303, Faculty of Science

events.description: Learn version control with tools like git and Github... Project collaboration wouldn't be easy without tools like this...
events.how_to_find_us: Enter a shuttle into UNILAG.  Its straight down the road opposite hydraulics. Ask for directions to computer science. The last building looking down is where E303 is located.

events.name: DevFest SW Nigeria 2017 - Ibadan

venue.name: The Great Hall - Nustreams Conference & Culture Centre
venue.address_1: Nustreams Conference & Culture Centre, 110, Abeokuta Road, Opp Alalubosa Estate GRA Extension, Ibadan

events.description:
Please register here: http://bit.ly/devfestsw17 as this is the official attendee list.

GDG South-West DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more! We will be having developers from all around the south-west region of Nigeria in one place to experience the best of Google technology.

Website: http://devfestsw.gdg.ng (http://devfestsw.gdg.ng/)

Collaborating GDGs: GDG Lagos, GDG FUNAAB, GDG OAU, GDG LAUTECH, GDG UNILAG, GDG Covenant University, GDG BELLS University, GDG Unilorin and GDG Osogbo

FAQs

1. Why do I have to register twice? - This is primarily because we are collaborating with other GDGs for this event so meetup is not sufficient for event registration.

2. If I RSVP on meetup do I still need to register on the Eventbrite page? - Yes, you need to register on Eventbrite. See 1 above.

3. Do I need to register for this event? - Yes, while it's a free event, registration is compulsory.

venue.name: University of Lagos

events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

events.name: IWD (International Women's Day) UNILAG 2018

venue.name: Grace Polytechnic Surulere

events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

International Women's Day is a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women. The day also marks a call to action for accelerating gender parity.
We are proud of the contributions women in technology have made across the world and this day is a moment to recognize their influence in the tech industry and beyond.

Overall objective of the event:
To bring to limelight reputable women, who don't normally get the spotlight but have done remarkable things in the tech world.
To motivate and encourage the younger ladies to aspire to be great women in tech.
To provide a platform for attendees to interact with reputable women in the tech industry.

Event Agenda

1. Doors Open, Registration

2. Welcome / Opening Remarks

3. Keynote

4. Panel

5. Local Demo

6. Lunch & Networking

7. Workshop Track 1: Code Lab: Android Things

Workshop Track 2: Speechless Workshop

8. Fireside Chat

9. Entertainment

10. Closing Remarks

‚Ä¢ What to bring

‚Ä¢ Important to know

Date: February 8th 2019
Venue: LT009, Faculty of Science
Time: 10am - 1pm

üèÆInterested teams will be given an opportunity to prepare themselves ahead of the major qualification come February 28th 2019

We will be helping you with:

‚ô¶Tips and materials to be used in preparation for the event.

‚ô¶Hands on workshop on how to participate.

‚ô¶An opportunity to meet with other tech enthusiasts and form a team.

events.name: Open Hack Week

venue.name: University of Lagos

events.description:
OHW is a week long hackathon aimed at celebrating student developers while exposing to building actual solutions to solve different organizational problems.
- Real life problems are enlisted by different organizations such as, NGOs, Start-ups, Tech companies etc.
- Participants are a team of 3-5 persons, each team is allocated a problem at random and is to work collaboratively in providing a suitable solution to the allocated problem.
- On the final day, participants who successfully completed the challenge will pitch and showcase their solutions to the sponsors. Organizations will select the best solution and celebrate the team by possibly providing compensation to complete the solution to a more advanced level.

AGENDA:

July 29th:
Event starts, necessary information concerning the hackathon is announced, organizations meet with participants to explain problem statement. The challenge kicks-off.

July 30th - Aug 1st:
Students work on the problems and try as much as possible to provide a working solution.

Aug. 2nd
Pitch preparation, CV writing, interview and career fair preparation

Aug 3rd
Grand finale, pitch session of solutions to organizations, career fair session, announcement of selected solutions by organizations and celebration of the participants

events.name: Meet and Greet with Developer Student Clubs Unilag

venue.name: Faculty Of Engineering, University Of Lagos

events.description:
In this event, we will be welcoming new members to the community and also meet with existing members.

We will be having a talk about what DSC is all about, how DSC can help you become a (better) developer, how the community operates and you will be added to the community.

Finally, you will also get a chance to meet the DSC Unilag organizing team.

*Special Guest*:
We will be having DSC Mentor, Oluwalolope Hope as a special guest at the event.

*Venue*:
Room 256, Electrical Engineering,Faculty of Engineering, University of Lagos

*Date*:
30th Aug 2019

*Time*:
3-5pm

events.name: Hacktoberfest Unilag

venue.name: Faculty Of Engineering, University Of Lagos

events.description:
It's Hacktoberfest 2019! Let's celebrate open source over food, drinks, learning, and great company!

Agenda

Who is in the room - 10am
Intro to open source, Git and GitHub - 10:30am
Intro to Hacktoberfest: the celebration, prizes, and instructions - 12pm

What's Hacktoberfest?

Hacktoberfest ‚Äî brought to you by DigitalOcean in partnership with DEV ‚Äî is a month-long celebration of open source software. Maintainers are invited to guide would-be contributors towards issues that will help move the project forward, and contributors get the opportunity to give back to both projects they like and others they've just discovered. No contribution is too small ‚Äî bug fixes and documentation updates are valid ways of participating.

Can't make it to this event? Hacktoberfest is virtual and open to participants from around the globe. Sign up to participate today at https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com.

Rules and prizes

First, sign up on the Hacktoberfest site at https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com. To qualify for the official limited edition Hacktoberfest shirt, you must register and make four pull requests between October 1-31. Pull requests can be to any public repo on GitHub, not just the ones with issues labeled Hacktoberfest. If a maintainer reports your pull request as spam or behavior not in line with the project‚Äôs code of conduct, you will be ineligible to participate.

Connect with other Hacktoberfest participants by using #hacktoberfest on your social media platform of choice.

New to DigitalOcean? Receive USD $50 in infrastructure credit at https://do.co/hacktoberfest50.

Events code of conduct

Hacktoberfest events are welcoming, open, and inclusive. Include this line on your event page: "Please read our Events Code of Conduct(https://do.co/hacktoberconduct) before attending. Happy Hacking!"

events.name: Design Thinking Workshop

venue.name: Faculty Of Engineering, University Of Lagos

events.description:
Developer Student Clubs (DSC) invites students to develop solutions for local community problems using one or more Google products or platforms. All DSC Unilag members are invited to this Solution Design Day to get to understand how the Solution Challenge works as well as requirements. On this day, 28th February, we will have 3 sessions covering UI/UX, Design Thinking and Product Design.

We would recommend this as a MUST attend for those who are interested in participating in the challenge.

If you don't have an idea yet, don't worry, this will be a perfect opportunity to brainstorm!!

Let's come together and build solutions üéâüéâüòé

events.name: FSI #PayAsYouKnow Hackathon

venue.name: Faculty Of Engineering, University Of Lagos

events.description:
Join this Whatsapp Group created for the event - https://chat.whatsapp.com/KSCgSK0ZQqvFhj18rpC4Xw

How would you innovate Identity and Payment systems to prevent fraud and keep people safe with payments?

The Financial Services Innovators have a goal to make Nigeria a global leader in innovative technology-driven financial services.

This is why The FSI in partnership with GDG Lagos and other partners is calling developers across the country who are interested in building innovative FinTech solutions using the Sandbox. The Sandbox is a safe and secure environment where innovators are excited to experiment with their FinTech solutions/ideas without regulatory inhibitions.

REGISTER: https://bit.ly/fsi-gdg-hack
MORE INFO: https://fsi.ng/hackathon/

upcoming.name: IWD 2020

venue.name: Online event

upcoming.description:
International Women's Day (IWD) is a day set aside for celebrating the socio-economic and cultural achievements of women in our society.

Here is a tentative schedule of the event

1. IamRemarkable Session - Tabitha Kavyu (DSC Lead, University of Nairobi)
2. How to spark the interest of women in the tech ecosystem and what can I do apart from coding? - Allela Eunice (Developer Ecosystem Community Manager at Google)
3. A panel session on your experience as a techie in school - Firdaus Nuzula, Patience Ankunda, Velda Kiara, Esther Akinloose.
4. My tech journey and closing keynote - Ifihan Olusheye (Team Co-ordinator, DSC Unilag)

Host: Mbaoma Chioma M. (Core Team Member, DSC Unilag)

Join us LIVE via - https://meet.jit.si/dscunilag

To get more highlights, kindly follow our official twitter handle https://www.twitter.com/dscunilag
